Hi there,
I’ve done some research without finding much. But I’m currently looking into the possibilities/limits of using FHIR with messaging.
Is anyone aware of projects (in any country) where messaging was used in a FHIR-based system? – In other words: Where I could find inspiration on integrating FHIR using messaging?
In the US there is http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-alerts/, we implemented it and we have couple of feeds in production (still way way less that HL7v2 though)
Denmark have the most experience at this
More at the dev in progress stage but a couple appearing https://simplifier.net/guide/nhsdigital/home

Hi @Friis80 , we (at Fresenius) have used FHIR for messaging in our FHIR ecosystem. We sync data from our EHR (which does not speak FHIR yet) to HealthCloud (Salesforce) via FHIR resources. OfCourse there is transformation involved from EHR -> FHIR -> HealthCloud but we are doing EHR -> FHIR already for other applications so we leveraged the same canonical model to supply data to HealthCloud. We transmit to the volume of 20M- 40M messages per day and we use kafka for the streaming. We have been in production for over 4 years and have had no issues. Notice that we are on STU3 currently.
PrescribeIT is a Canadian messaging-based e-prescribing interface.

MedCom has the following messaging IG, http://build.fhir.org/ig/hl7dk/dk-medcom/
It contains: CareCommunication, HospitalNotificationMessage and MessagingAcknowledgement.
-It has not been used in production yet.
